resources.string: Beyond Baguio Cafe offers a modern yet Cordilleran interior design and a wide al fresco dining space, providing an astonishing atmosphere for a peaceful and quiet dining experience. The food, including rice meals and pasta, is tasty but may not always be served hot. The cafes delicious coffee and blueberry cheesecake are highly recommended for satisfying cravings.

Stella Cafe and Bar at The Cullinan Hotel offers a delightful al fresco dining experience with a relaxed ambiance. Drawing inspiration from Paris, this charming establishment is located on the ground floor of the Southern Sun Cullinan Hotel. Guests can savor South Africas finest wines while being guided by their resident sommelier in an intimate wine room. To further enhance the experience, visitors can enjoy refreshing afternoon drinks by the stunning pool terrace and indulge in delectable dishes from the seasonal menu.

Feeling cold from the breeze? Head over to this Baguio cafe in Camp John Hay for a warm hug in a mug! This charming place features traditional Filipino hot chocolate, made with the good stuff - local cacao beans! But wait, theres more! They also have fantastic coffee and yummy local treats like bibingka and suman to complete your Filipino merienda experience.

Arcas Yard, more than just a cafe, is a peaceful haven where you can get away from the rush of the city. Its tucked away amid the greenery on the edges of Baguio. It also offers a special concept, combining a cafe, library, and museum in one place. This hidden gem, surrounded by stunning views of the mountains, has a tranquil ambiance thats ideal for relaxing with a cup of freshly prepared coffee or herbal tea.

Mix coffee and comedy at this Baguio cafe! Not your average joe (pun intended), its a creative space where folks can sip on local specialty coffee and tea, exchange ideas, and maybe even crack a few jokes. Plus, theyve got a whole menu of breakfast treats, pastas, and sandwiches to make your tummy happy. Its the perfect spot to unleash your inner comedian (or just appreciate some good stand-up) with a cup of brew in hand!

The Catholic cathedral in Baguio City, Philippines is a stunning building with a distinctive pink fa√ßade and rose window. It is popular for its beauty and is one of the top tourist destinations in Baguio City.

St. Joseph the Worker Parish Church is situated in the Pacdal Circle area, making it a convenient stop for families visiting nearby attractions such as Botanical Garden, Wright Park, the Mansion, and Mines View Park. It is well-organized with ample parking space and has undergone renovations including a designated cry room for families with young children. The churchs spacious interior and adjacent prayer rooms provide a serene environment for visitors to engage in quiet reflection or candle lighting.

St. Vincent Ferrer Church, the earliest religious establishment in Baguio, predates the well-known Baguio Cathedral. This sacred place served as a mission station for Catholic missionaries before the Cathedrals construction. Located outside the city center, it offers a tranquil environment for devout individuals to engage in prayer and worship. Notably, this church also houses a columbarium where loved ones can find eternal rest.

Holy Family Parish Church in Bakakeng North, Baguio City, Benguet is a spacious and beautifully designed Catholic church with a huge altar and high ceilings. It is located in a serene area within the community, offering a peaceful environment for prayer and reflection. The church is known for its active engagement with youth members and hosts various activities. Despite its remote location, it is easily accessible by jeepney from Baguio Plaza.

St. John Don Bosco Parish Church in Trancoville, Baguio City is a serene and peaceful place to visit, especially during weekdays to avoid the crowds. If you attend Sunday mass, be sure to arrive early for a good seat. On Sundays and holidays, the church is surrounded by vendors selling religious items and souvenirs. The church offers a tranquil environment with ample parking space and is well-maintained despite needing some wall painting.

The Ampersand is a popular nightclub located in the heart of Baguio City, within The Camp, which is known as the city's nightlife hub. It attracts a young crowd, mainly college-age young adults and young professionals. The club features vibrant dance tunes played by energetic DJs, making it an ideal spot for those looking to dance the night away. On weekends, the venue tends to get crowded, so timing your visit is crucial..

Basmnt is a pub located inside Ritz Legarda hotel in Baguio City. It offers great views of the city from its basement and is perfect for relaxing after a day of sightseeing or excitement. The pub has an extensive menu with plenty of options for food and drink, as well as some hearty meals if you're looking to refuel.

If you're in the mood to party, then Spade Superclub is the place for you! They usually have guest DJs and performers who will keep patrons entertained all night long. As for food and drinks, you're going to have a great time eating and drinking!

Alberto's Bar is a popular spot among locals in Baguio, offering a vibrant atmosphere and live music that ranges from beloved American country tunes to traditional Cordilleran melodies. The bar exudes a fantastic vibe, with talented performers and a wide selection of drinks and food. While the music can be quite loud, creating an energetic ambiance where dancing is encouraged, it may not be the best choice for those seeking a more relaxed setting for conversation.

Vesper Sports Bar is a popular spot for sports and socializing. It has a wide selection of beers and cocktails, as well as TVs for watching the game. The atmosphere is relaxed and friendly, and there's usually plenty of seating available.

The 'mother of all parks' in Baguio city, the summer capital of the Philippines, is a 32.84-hectare park designed by, and named after, American architect and urban planner Daniel Hudson Burnham, who also designed the original plan for Baguio City as well as Dewey Boulevard (now Roxas Boulevard) in Manila. The park has 12 main areas, the most popular of which are the Burnham Lagoon, a man-made lake with rowboats for hire; a childrens playground; a skating rink; the Rose Garden and the Picnic Grove.

DMines View Park is one of the famous tourist spots across Baguio, packed with shops selling snacks, trinkets, botanical items, and others. Picture-taking services with traditional Igorot clothes, horses, dogs, and more are also available in the lower half of the park. The park also overlooks nearby mountains, forests, and Itogon's abandoned mines.

Mirador Heritage and Eco-Park is one of the newest destinations in Baguio City. It is located where the famed Lourdes Grotto stands. The park is huge, covering the top of Mirador Hill. Some parts of the park are based on known tourist destinations in Kyoto, Japan, including the Arashiyama Bamboo Grove and the Tori Gate at the Mirador Peace Memorial. Aside from those, the park houses the Jesuit Villa and Retreat House and Cafe Inigo by Ebai.
The Baguio Botanical Garden, formerly known as Imelda Park, is a botanical garden in Baguio, Philippines, located on Leonard Wood Road between Wright Park and Teacher's Camp.[2]

The Park has a large diversity of flora and fauna, many of which are endemic to the mountain. Its wildlife includes threatened mammals such as the Philippine Brown Deer, Northern Luzon Giant Cloud Rat and the Luzon Pygmy Fruit Bat. One can also find several orchid species some of which are possibly endemic to Mt. Pulag, and other rare flora such as the pitcher plant.
